markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Depth Gauge](/Equipment.aspx?ID=866)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [PFS Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=50) pg. 114

**Price** 1 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Hands** 2

**Bulk** L
</row>

**Access** Member of the Pathfinder Society.

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This simple tool consists of a small iron weight attached to a thin rope that is marked at regular intervals (typically every foot). It can be used to measure the depth of a hole or body of water by dropping the weight down into unknown depths and counting the markings on the rope. It can also be used as a plumb bob.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Depth Gauge
